intro: Dolomiaea saussureoides, commonly known as the saussureoides groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a low-growing habit with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. Dolomiaea saussureoides is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various soil conditions.
